headline: Iced Pumpkin Cookies
description: Soft pumpkin cookies made with canned pumpkin, perfectly spiced with cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves, and drizzled with icing make a cozy fall treat.

video.name: How to Make Iced Pumpkin Cookies

name: Iced Pumpkin Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two cookie sheets.
Make cookies: Combine flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, nutmeg, cloves, and salt in a medium bowl.

Cream together sugar and butter in a mixing bowl until fluffy, 2 to 3 minutes. Add pumpkin, egg, and vanilla; beat until creamy. Mix in flour mixture until combined. Drop tablespoonfuls of dough onto the prepared cookie sheets; flatten slightly.
Bake in the preheated oven until centers are set, 15 to 20 minutes, switching racks halfway through. Transfer cookies to a wire rack to cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, make icing: Stir together confectioners' sugar, milk, butter, and vanilla in a bowl until smooth. Add milk as needed, to achieve drizzling consistency.
Drizzle icing over cooled cookies with a fork.

review.reviewBody: Loved these. They worked great with King Arthur gluten free 1 to 1 flour. I halved the recipe but had a derp moment and forgot to halve the pumpkin and they still turned out wonderful. I used mini semi sweet chocolate chips in the batter instead of frosting. I love that these are light and fluffy and not overwhelmingly sweet.
I use spiced syrup instead of vanilla extract for the icing. Just don't use too much and have the icing not want to set fully like this batch lol

Followed directions exactly. Soft texture is great and they don't fall when you take them out of the oven. They are easy and cheap to make. I made mixed cookie platters for about 20 families and I received a couple compliments on this particular cookie but no one guessed they were pumpkin. Everyone thought they were a gingerbread cake cookie. The cookie doesn't taste great without icing. The icing doesn't taste great on it's own. Together they worked well. This is a decent cookie but nothing amazing. If I were to take one kind of cookie to a party, this isn't going to be it. However, they are a really nice addition to a holiday cookie platter. Next time, I'm going to try making the icing with Nestle pumpkin spice morsels.

I make several batches every year and they are a fan favorite. I use a smaller cookie scoop and don't flatten so my cook time is about 14 minutes. If I don't have all of the spices, I'll sub for 1 1/2 tsp cinnamon and 1 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice. I also add a dash of cinnamon to the icing. Highly recommend this recipe!
Good. Not too sweet. 4 stars just because they are more like muffin tops than cookies. Would be good with breakfast though.
Really easy recipe to make my daughter and I loved making these.

This is a delicious recipe. My daughter and I love making this. They were beautiful until I put them in an airtight container. I had let the icing dry and stacked them with layers of parchment paper. After being stored, even for just an hour, the icing seemed to melt and they seemed to "sweat". They were not nearly as pretty afterwards. Why did this happen?
Everyone in my family loves these. They are moist and perfect for fall. I made them for a fall festival at my kids' school one year. They turn out great ever time.
these cookies are yummy. The recipe is perfect If you are picky about calories, they do not need the icing. They are very good without icing

Just made this, as in, they came out of the oven 20 minutes ago. They're perfect! I'm about to start the icing, they're absolutely delicious. I followed the recipe exactly, and used a cookie scoop though, and baked for 20 minutes. I think I could have gotten away with 18 minutes. But they're so good and my house smells amazing!
Yummy üòã cookies our family loved
I loved these and my man loved them. However I did not use the icing recipe. I made a cream cheese drizzle icing. very simple and makes a lot.
Soft chewy delicious
Very nice cake style cookies. Subtle pumpkin flavor, just right. I added about 1/2 tsp of cinnamon to icing, nice little touch.

My husband Loved these and had to make more, perfect fall treat. I used pumpkin pie spice instead of all the spices and did add an extra tsp. of Pumpkin pie spice to recipie. Will be making again soon, great with coffee!
Yummy
Delicious!!!!!!
Great tasting recipe. Very nice pumpkin taste with icing allowing for a shot of real sweetness. A definite keeper for the Fall!

Made these for everyone at work but took a tub of purchased cream cheese frosting as I was out of icing sugar. Served them with little spreading knives so people could top them or eat without. Many requests for the recipe! I also used my large cookie scoop so they looked all even.

I've never left a review on a food site, but I made an account today because I felt so compelled to do so for these cookies. Holy sh*t, these are the best cookies I've ever had. I'm not a huge cookie gal, so I planned on making these for my husband and his family. However, I'm not sure there'll be any left for me to share. Make these now.

Yum ! Soft and not too sweet . I pumpkin and cinnamon for my spices . I did half of the batch with the icing the the other half I added semi sweet chocolate chips . The both are so good and great with up of tea or coffee
I made them for our bowling league. I got a lot of "these are my new favorites". Very easy to make.
Turned out pretty dang good. A+
This recipe was delicious! Super easy and quick! The glaze topping from the recipe didn‚Äôt work for me originally but i just added about a half cup more of milk and it was perfect!
Tasty recipe! Easy! I substituted Splenda 1:1 for sugar and did not do the yummy looking glaze as some loved ones are diabetic. Still tasty! thank you!

This is my favorite pumpkin cookie recipe. Variations one can use: try 1/2 Cup of chopped walnuts and 1/2 Cup raisins or cranberry bits. Can use brown sugar instead of white, can throw in 1/2 t of ginger to kick it up another notch.

Used a butter substitute and they turned out fine. I upped the spice a bit, because I like it that way. Note that the recipe calls for what ends up being almost exactly half a can (small) of pumpkin, so easy to double the recipe, as I did.
These are fantastic. I added a package of white chocolate chips to the final batter and stirred. The results were decadent!
Even my pumpkin-hating sister loves these cookies. I made them a bit larger than the recipe suggests and doused them with the icing. excellent, cake-like cookies.
Delicious!
They are so good‚Ä¶ but here‚Äôs a tip. Smear them with a generous dollop of cream cheese icing instead of the glaze suggested here.
Great recipe. I would use this recipe again.

Made this recipe for the first time today and everyone in the family loved them! Drizzled the icing on in a zig zag pattern and was just enough to politely taste the sugar. Soft and chewy on the inside and a little crunch on the bottom. Delectable! Will definitely make these again. Thanks for yet again a terrific recipe!

I used one cup of whole wheat flour in place of one cup of white, so basically 1.5c white and 1c wheat. Used about 1 1/3c pumpkin and added raisins to the batter instead of icing these. they came out great. Light and fluffy batter and yummy cookies.,

These turned out great. The only suggestion I would have for the recipe is to add how long the cookies cool on the cookie sheet vs. the cooling rack. I cooled em on the sheet for two minutes and they were secure enough to remove to the cooling rack.
Just, whoa. I swapped a half cup of the white sugar with dark brown sugar and added cinnamon to the icing. These are amazing.

Turned out amazing! Definitely don‚Äôt store in an airtight container the cookies are too moist and will get mushy. Had the on the counter in a glass cake stand and that was perfect, they lasted for a whole week like that. Will definitely be making these again!

I have made these for several years now in the fall and they turn out perfect. They are soft cake-like cookies. Occasionally if I need a chocolate fix, I throw in some semi-sweet chocolate chips. This recipe is perfect as it is! No need to change sugar ratio or alter the guts of this recipe. I always get compliments. Its the perfect amount of sweet and spice. As others have stated, because of the moisture in the pumpkin they can be left out on the counter.
I substituted applesauce for the butter. Also, I used 1/2 C maple syrup and 1/2 C white sugar instead of 1 C white sugar. The cookies are cake-like and delicious.
I have made these for my family and they love it! We can‚Äôt get enough and they are gone within days!

I made these exactly as written. Made a gigantic batch for my neighbors over the holidays with other types of cookies as well. Any time I saw a neighbor, the first thing they would comment on was these pumpkin cookies. Big thumbs up from everyone. They are a more cakey type of cookie. Something different than I normally would make and I‚Äôm glad I tried it.
Followed recipe exactly. Turned out delicious!

These turned out exactly like I was hoping for. My MIL used to send us a giant box of cookies every Christmas but she‚Äôs not up to the task anymore. The pumpkin cookies were always my husband‚Äôs favorite so I‚Äôve been looking for a substitute. I was worried because the dough was super sticky so just let it drop off the spoon, all ugly. But they smooth out, for the most part in the oven. The glaze was easy to whip up and the finished product was excellent.
These are great just as written.

These are very delicious! I used 1 cup white sugar and 1/2 cup brown sugar based on others recommendations and they turned out beautifully. I love that they aren‚Äôt an overly sweet cookie. The icing adds just a touch of sweetness. My kids even loved them and neither of them usually eat pumpkin items.
Great cookie! Definitely cakey. Followed recipe exactly and got rave reviews.
I love this cookie! I even add chocolate chips. The texture is similar to pumpkin bread. The icing drizzled on top gives it a little extra sweetness.

According to my kids - BEST COOKIE EVER! I took two suggestions from other reviewers. I substituted 1/2 cup of white sugar for brown sugar and I used a cream cheese icing made of 4 tbsp softened butter, 4 oz softened cream cheese, 2 cups powdered sugar, 1/2 tsp vanilla and 3 tbsp milk. The cream cheese icing is plenty to drizzle over one batch of these delicious cookies! You will not be disappointed. Thank you for sharing!
Delicious! I make the dough exactly as written and add white chocolate chips. I don't make the drizzle, the chips are enough!

I made this recipe but could not resist adding mini chocolate chips for my granddaughters. I also to a tip from the reviews and used the cream cheese icing, then added a little Christmas flair and voila! A hit!!

I made these last night when friends came over, they were a hit. Followed the recipe exactly for the cookies but had some cream cheese frosting on hand, in the pantry, so I melted some and drizzled that on top instead. We're in the mountains of Colorado and I baked them in my Ninja air fryer, that also bakes, for about 17-18 minutes (don't know if that makes a difference, but just putting that out there). They came out light and fluffy, they reminded us of cake, gonna have to try them with raisins or nuts next time . My friends and I enjoyed them even without the frosting, so good! Thanks for the recipe!!??

No substitutions, followed the recipe as is. However, being in the UK, I mixed 50/50 plain flour and white bread flour and got an even softer texture than I used to get in the US with AP flour. Absolutely delicious!
No changes and really liked it.
I love this recipe. Not only simple, but easy to add extra goodies to as well. (I went with Nestles' espresso chips and sliced almonds.)
These cookies have a cake-like texture and taste better the next day, so make them the night before. Excellent! Substitute half the white sugar for golden brown sugar.
Great recipe! easy and simple ingredients you probably already have in your pantry. I added walnuts, too. I will make again!
Mine didn‚Äôt look as pretty as they were in the picture, but they tasted really good. I added 3 chocolate chips on the top of each cookie.
I made these exactly as is but used cream cheese icing, sprinkles them with cinnamon and topped with pecans! AMAZING!!
Absolutely LOVE this cookies! They are like the yummy crust of the pumpkin cake, but BETTER! I might need to invite a lot of friend a to share the yumminess with!
Delicious. I thought they were much better though after they sat in a covered container to soften a bit.
Absolutely excellent! I substituted 1/2 cup of brown sugar for white sugar and added a little ginger. They came out slightly crispy on the outside and soft and cake-like on the inside. Delicious!
Delicious. I added spice to the icing. Turned out great.
These are delightful. Like cake! I don‚Äôt glaze them, but I do add dried cranberries. A sweet fall treat!
A perfect fall dessert! These were like cakes! Very light and fluffy. Icing adds a nice touch. Would recommend this to people who like pumpkin spice.
Delicious!
My wife loves pretty much anything pumpkin. So I made these for her, and she absolutely loved them. Her co-workers couldn‚Äôt believe her husband cooks!
this was amazing!!!!! it was perfectly light and wasn‚Äôt crisp at all
Great Cookies.
Was skeptical at first, because of the puree. They are moist & delicious and, now added to my favorites.
Amazing cookies! Will be a new annual fall tradition to make these, for sure.

I have been using this recipe for several years and they are wonderful. My daughter made them the first time and accidentally add a can of pumpkin rather than a cup. We still make them this way. They are just like muffin tops. We do not frost them, they don‚Äôt need it but we do add cinnamon chips when we have them. This is a fall favorite!
These are fabulous! They disappear quickly. The amount of frosting is double what's needed. So . . . just double the cookie dough ingredients and you'll be set.

I have been baking these cookies for years and most people say it is the best cookies they ever had. 

I only add a dash of cloves and not 1/2 teaspoon in the recipe. 

I add 1/2 teaspoon of ginger. 

I also make cream cheese icing as a personal favorite.
Great recipe. Added Butterscotch chips to the batter. Rave reviews by the group.
I changed white sugar to brown sugar, decreased sugar by half and added 1 3oz package of sugar free instant vanilla pudding. Perfect without frosting

I used the entire 15 oz can of pumpkin. And instead of cookies I spread the dough out on a 11x15 cookie sheet. And made the glaze adding a bit of pumpkin spice seasoning.
So good..will make again using the sheet pan)
These are sweet, yummy cookies. I didn't make any changes.

Awesome recipe, I made a batch and a half to use the full can of pumpkin. Here is the breakdown : 3 3/4 c flour, 11/2 tsp bakin powder and bakin soda, 3tsp cinnamon, 3/4 tsp cloves,4/4 tsp salt, 3/4 cup shortening,21/4 cups sugar,1 15 oz can pumpkin pur√©e, 2 eggs 1.5 tsp vanilla, I also add a tsp ginger and nutmeg and walnuts and raisins.
Really good cookies with a nice texture, very soft. I doubled all the spices and added old fashioned oats and a whole 15 oz can of pumpkin.
An old favorite recipe; no idea where it originally came from. An alternate version my family loves to do is use less clove, forget the glaze, and just add chocolate chips to the batter ??

I made a lot of changes to amp up the warmth of the cookie as the original recipe just was too basic for me.
I used 1/2 cup of dark brown sugar with 1 cup of white, I added broken pieces of walnuts and pecans and dried cranberries throughout the batter. I also used 2 tsp of pumpkin spice and 1/2 cinnamon. When on the cookie sheet I pressed a few more broken nut pieces onto the top.
For the icing I made it with maple syrup and vanilla and drizzled it, then dusted them with cinnamon.
They are beautiful, and everyone requests them at gatherings.
These did not last long in my house. Everyone loved them!!

I‚Äôve been making this recipe for years now and it is SUCH a big hit. Visiting old friends always comes along with ‚Äúcan you make those pumpkin cookies?‚Äù Super popular, and super easy to make. I make them exactly as the recipe states.
Thumb up!! Can freeze them up with glazed on.
Turned out perfect. I went by the recipe and it turned out wonderful!

This was SO GOOD!! My whole family was obsessed. Some advice, if you want a hint of more spice, add a 1/4 teaspoon more of cinnamon:) Also, only drizzle the icing, because if you spread it all over, it tends to overpower the cookie. A must bake:)

I loved this recipe!! I was gone in an hour!!!
Delicious!!!!
We loved these cookies. We did not do the icing, which leaves the cookies a little less sweet for a more wholesome snack. Perfect!
This is a great recipe. We followed the recipe exactly and the cookies turned out moist and tasty with and without the icing. We'll definitely make these again.
Perfect consistency and perfect flavor. A little messy with the drissle but everything worked out great anyway.
Made as stated but used my own cream cheese frosting recipe instead of the glaze stated.

I used the seasoned canned pumpkin then added 1/2 of the additional spices recommended in the recipe. I followed the rest of the directions and they are delicious! My husband and next door neighbor LOVED THEM and so do I. They are crisp on the edges and soft inside, melt in your mouth Yum. For some of the batter I added white chocolate chips which gave additional sweetness and texture. Delicious with or without. 
As for the glaze, WOW! The flavor as well as the fact it hardens just enough to not be messy on our fingers was perfection. Thank you for sharing. (I'm getting ready to make another batch right now)
I also substituted 1/2 cup of the white sugar with brown, and they were delicious . I got lazy and just sprinkled confectionary sugar over them and they were still the best cookie I‚Äôve ever baked.
I had some leftover pumpkin from making pies so I tried these cookies and they were absolutely delicious

Great idea. Needs some adjustments. Expected it to come out tasting like pumpkin pie but instead it tasted like a gingerbread man and there's no ginger. I followed the recipe to the letter. 

My wife suggested I run the last batch with some added clover, nutmeg and pumpkin puree. That last batch tasted like Pumpkin Pie. I plan on making again and this time with extra puree and a touch more nutmeg and clover. Mostly extra puree. Overall a solid cookie recipe with a novel flavor palette.
Very delicious!!! People liked them with and without the icing too!
These where very easy to make and a great flavour

Cookies turned out good, not great but good. They are cake like as others have said. I substituted an equal amount of pumpkin pie spice for the spices listed and as others have suggested, added a small amount of brown sugar. I would say to cut the icing amount in half since the recipe makes way more than needed.

Delicious but very soft, more like a muffin top rather than cookie. In place of 1 1/2 cups white sugar, I did 3/4 cup brown sugar and a little less than 3/4 cup monk fruit sweetner. I used a whole can of pumpkin puree instead of just 1 cup. In place of all the spices, I used 3 tsp pumpkin pie spice. It was a hit.
